content: Palettes were generated from individual images of each chapter level using Color Thief. Changing the number of colors in the palette can result in variability in individual colors. 5 felt like a manageable set. You can view the generator script on Github.

Chapter images were not included on this site for performance reasons. Also, because I didn't feel like it. If you're curious about the source images, I encourage you to play the game. You can also peek into the source images on the repository.

If you are a Monument Valley fanatic (or just a casual lover of the game), you are probably aware that there is a Monument Valley II as well as a few mini-games that have their own storylines, chapters, and thus palettes. I'm actively working on including the rest.

Source code is available on Github. There's an extensive README if you'd like to set this up locally or if you'd like to use the code as a foundation for your own color palette generator. Please open issues there accordingly.
